text: How do I create a new role for my users?

Hi all :slightly_smiling_face: :wave:
Is there a way to block certain domain from submitting all of the forms? Not only particular one? I mean, can I block certain domain users from submitting all of my forms?

Just shooting from the hip, but you might be able to solve it by listening for browser language / country through geo location of the visitor and then add a display none styling to all forms or their submit buttons - or maybe even disabling the submit buttons.

They should all have a generic class to target.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#http-request-variables>
thank you!
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/How-to-detect-IP-country-to-show-relevant-Menu/m-p/782021>
Look for Barry’s answer and Piers reply to Barry
thanks so much! aprreciate! :slightly_smiling_face:
You’re welcome :slightly_smiling_face:
Oh and just so you know. We have a website that uses request.headers and still scoring 89+ in Google Page Speed Insights on mobile
So test it out and evaluate the impact

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

Hey Guys!! :wave:

I am working on a website rebuild in HubSpot.
*How can I develop the new site without affect the current one?*

I tried creating a sandbox env but how can I migrate the pages, theme, hubdb data and assets across to the real HubSpot app when development is ready?
As far as I know, I could not find a way of transferring them across accounts

Same theme? Or different?

I would dev the theme first, then use content staging to build the pages and replace them in the live environment without having to move them back and forth (which isn't possible)
Different theme
So I'd need to build everything on my current live HubSpot account, and then just don't publish the pages?
You would dev the theme, modules and templates, but build the pages in content staging so you don't lose all your current page analytics
Oh I didn't know I could use a different theme with content staging..
You just choose the "blank page" option instead of starting with a cloned page
When you stage an existing page, it gives you a choice
Ohh got it! Thanks for the help :wink:
